text: Nita Martan (1898–1986) was an American stage and film actress, active in the silent and early sound eras.Munden p.193 ==Selected filmography== * The Son of Tarzan (1920) (credited as Manilla Martan) * Sidewalks of New York (1922) (credited as Manilla Martan) * The Wolf's Fangs (1923) (credited as Manilla Martans) * Hereafter credited as Nita Martan: * Lost at the Front (1927) * Dog Justice (1928) * Lady Be Good (1928) * Twin Beds (1929) * Borrowed Wives (1930) * Chasing Rainbows (1930) * The Third Alarm (1930) * Two Gun Man (1931) * Anybody's Blonde (1931) * Caught Cheating (1931) ==References== ==Bibliography== * Munden, Kenneth White. The American Film Institute Catalog of Motion Pictures Produced in the United States, Part 1. University of California Press, 1997. ==External links== * Category:1898 births Category:1986 deaths Category:American film actresses Category:People from Colorado
title: Nita Martan
